intro: Lastrea falciloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in its natural habitat.
